com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.schema

Enum ConsistencyModifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ConsistencyModifier>
      • com.thinkaurelius.titan.core.schema.ConsistencyModifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ConsistencyModifier>

    public enum ConsistencyModifier
extends Enum<ConsistencyModifier>
    Used to control Titan's consistency behavior on eventually consistent or other non-transactional backend systems. The consistency behavior can be defined for individual TitanSchemaElements which then applies to all instances.

    Consistency modifiers are installed on schema elements via TitanManagement.setConsistency(TitanSchemaElement, ConsistencyModifier) and can be read using TitanManagement.getConsistency(TitanSchemaElement).

    Author:
    Matthias Broecheler (me@matthiasb.com)

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      DEFAULT
      Uses the default consistency model guaranteed by the enclosing transaction against the configured storage backend.
      FORK
      Causes Titan to delete and add a new edge/property instead of overwriting an existing one, hence avoiding potential concurrent write conflicts.
      LOCK
      Locks will be explicitly acquired to guarantee consistency if the storage backend supports locks.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • DEFAULT

        public static final ConsistencyModifier DEFAULT
        Uses the default consistency model guaranteed by the enclosing transaction against the configured storage backend.

        What this means exactly, depends on the configuration of the storage backend as well as the (optional) configuration of the enclosing transaction.

      • LOCK

        public static final ConsistencyModifier LOCK
        Locks will be explicitly acquired to guarantee consistency if the storage backend supports locks.

        The exact consistency guarantees depend on the configured lock implementation.

        Note, that locking may be ignored under certain transaction configurations.

      • FORK

        public static final ConsistencyModifier FORK
        Causes Titan to delete and add a new edge/property instead of overwriting an existing one, hence avoiding potential concurrent write conflicts. This only applies to multi-edges and list-properties.

        Note, that this potentially impacts how the data should be read.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static ConsistencyModifier[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (ConsistencyModifier c : ConsistencyModifier.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static ConsistencyModifier valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
